# gradle-catalog

> A Gradle Version Catalog providing centralized dependency and plugin version management for Java/Kotlin projects.

## Overview

This project publishes a Gradle version catalog (TOML file) that can be consumed by other Gradle projects to standardize dependency versions. It contains no application source codeâ€”only Gradle build configuration.

- **Group ID**: com.rubensgomes
- **Artifact ID**: gradle-catalog
- **License**: Apache License 2.0
- **Repository**: https://github.com/rubensgomes/gradle-catalog

## Project Structure

- `gradle/libs.versions.toml` - The version catalog (core artifact)
- `build.gradle.kts` - Build configuration (Kotlin DSL)
- `settings.gradle.kts` - Settings and plugin management
- `gradle.properties` - Project metadata and version

## Build Commands

```bash
./gradlew clean build      # Clean and build
./gradlew clean publish    # Publish to Maven repository
./gradlew release          # Execute release workflow
```

## Version Catalog Contents

The `libs.versions.toml` catalog defines:

- **[versions]** - Version numbers for dependencies (Kotlin, Spring Boot, Jackson, JUnit, etc.)
- **[libraries]** - Dependency coordinates using version references
- **[bundles]** - Grouped libraries (jakarta-bean-validator, junit-jupiter, kotlin-junit5, logback)
- **[plugins]** - Gradle plugins (Kotlin, Spring Boot, Spotless, Lombok, etc.)

## Usage

Consuming projects reference this catalog in their `settings.gradle.kts`:

```kotlin
dependencyResolutionManagement {
    versionCatalogs {
        create("libs") {
            from("com.rubensgomes:gradle-catalog:<version>")
        }
    }
}
```

Then use in `build.gradle.kts`:

```kotlin
dependencies {
    implementation(libs.commons.configuration2)
    testImplementation(libs.bundles.kotlin.junit5)
}
```

## Publishing

Artifacts are published to GitHub Packages Maven repository. Requires `GITHUB_USER` and `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variables.
